description:
1 x Plane tree (LBI TPO (NO.367) 2007/T37)  located in the South West corner of Charthouse Square Garden 

Description of works: To crown lift sub-lateral branches over road and Charterhouse car park (south and south-western corner) to a height of approximately 12-14 metres above ground level. Removal of two lowest branches on stem to south-western corner. Crown reduce south-western aspect of canopy by up to 6-7 metres to strong lateral growth (35%) and crown reduce the remainder of the tree by up to 3 metres to strong lateral growth (20%) to balance the crown. In addition, further pruning, if needed, of up to 2 metres to allow the safe use of the crane  

Reason for works: The pruning will allow the siting of a crane to facilitate the installation of a bridge.
decision_conditions:
Condition: During the weekend of the installation of the crane (its final position furthest from the base of the tree), a tree consultant, in addition to tree surgeons, must be in attendance in case further pruning is needed for this or any branches that are damaged during the crane operation.

Reason: To ensure that the crane is furthest away from the tree as it can be , and if any subsequent pruning is needed, it will be kept to a minimum to lessen the affect that the all pruning has on the amenity value of the tree.
